Care Solace is an online resource with a live 24/7 phone line meant to help anyone find local mental health-related programs and counseling services.

To use Care Solace, individuals answer ten basic questions to receive referrals to applicable care providers.

Care Solace takes into account all types of private insurance including Medi-Cal, Medicaid, and Medicare and those that have no insurance.

Care Solace does not require a name, address, phone number, or date of birth. All of the information you provide is completely confidential and stored securely.

This week’s weather has been quite eventful and filled with many unexpected surprises, such as rolling power outages across San Jose and the Bay Area. Due to the strain on the power grid during this excessive heat event, the California Grid Operator (CAISO) may call for rolling power outages through Wednesday, August 19, 2020.

We are well aware this may add additional disruption to the start of this school year. Communication between all of us will be critical.

Families, if you are out of power and your student cannot login to class, please contact your teacher and/or school office as soon as you are able so we can make note of your issue and mark your child’s attendance record appropriately. Please keep in mind, our teachers and staff may have the same issue given many are working remotely. Your school site will communicate with you in the event staff are unable to connect due to power outage issues, and when they are back online and available to work with students.

We thank you in advance for your patience and flexibility as we work through possible power outages this week.

We are pleased to announce the selection for Summerdale Elementary school principal. Congratulations to Dr. Samantha Rainer!

She is a familiar face to the Summerdale community. She has been the instructional coach supporting Summerdale for the last three years, and is currently serving as one of our summer school co-principals.

Dr. Rainer earned her doctorate in 2009 from the University of San Francisco in International and Multicultural Education. She has worked in Berryessa Union since 2004 and has been an instructional coach in the district since 2014. We look forward to her leadership at Summerdale.

Dr. Rainer shares, “I'm excited to join the Summerdale community for the 2020-2021 school year. I look forward to collaborating with teachers, classified staff, and parents to provide the best learning opportunities for our students.”

Join us in also thanking Ms. Patty McDonald for her service to BUSD as she retires. We wish her well as she begins an exciting new chapter in her life!

Welcome back to "Storytime with Dr. Fuentes"! Today's story is "Strega Nona" about a Grandma Witch who helped people with their troubles. After Strega Nona realized she needed help, she hires Big Anthony to help her at home. One evening, he does exactly what Strega Nona told him not to do. Follow along to find out what Big Anthony did.

Every story teaches a lesson. What do you think Big Anthony learned in this story? Write a letter to Big Anthony, and let him know what he did wrong and why he must follow directions.

Today's second part of the activity is not only fun but delicious! We encourage you to make spaghetti for dinner with your family. While preparing dinner, come up with your own magic words to cook the pasta and magic words to make it stop.
As always, don't forget to share your pictures and/or videos on our Facebook or Twitter pages using the hashtags #PathwayToTheFuture and #BUSDLearnsAtHome.

See you next week!
